definition: bird writing, a calligraphic style based on seal script 篆书, but with characters decorated as birds and insects
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Recently there appeared two works that mentioned the so-called Qi State bird-worm inscription existing in the Qi bronze wares.
sentences.chinese: 近來有兩種論著提到所謂齊國銅器中的鳥蟲書。
